filename.description: Path to a file with an array or an image.
filename.title: filename

position.description: Indices of starting row and column, used when fitting noise todetector.

ModelChargeCollectionSimpleCollection.title: Model 'simple_collection'

ModelChargeCollectionSimpleFullWell.description: Limit the amount of charge in pixel due to full well capacity.
ModelChargeCollectionSimpleFullWell.title: Model 'simple_full_well'

ModelChargeCollectionSimpleIpc.description: Convolve pixel array with the IPC kernel.
ModelChargeCollectionSimpleIpc.title: Model 'simple_ipc'

ModelChargeGenerationChargeBlocks.description: Inject a block of charge into the :term:`CCD` detector.

block_end.description: Ending row for the injected charge.
block_end.title: block_end

block_start.description: Starting row of the injected charge.
block_start.title: block_start

ModelChargeGenerationChargeBlocks.title: Model 'charge_blocks'

ModelChargeGenerationChargeDeposition.description: Simulate charge deposition by ionizing particles using a stoppingpower curve.

ehpair_creation.description: the energy required to generate a electron-hole pair in eV by defaultthe Si value at room temperature is parsed i.e. 3.65 eV
ehpair_creation.title: ehpair_creation

energy_mean.description: the mean energy of the incoming ionizing particles in MeV
energy_mean.title: energy_mean

energy_spectrum.description: the location of the file describing the energy spectrum of incidentparticles if no spectrum is provided energies are randomly drawn froma normal distribution with mean and spread defined above note that theenergy spectrum is assumed to be a txt file with two columns [energy,flux] with the energy in MeV
energy_spectrum.title: energy_spectrum

energy_spectrum_sampling.description: "log" or None: the energy spectrum is sampled in log space "linear" :the energy spectrum is sampled in linear space
energy_spectrum_sampling.title: energy_spectrum_sampling

energy_spread.description: the spread in energy of the incoming ionizing particles in MeV
energy_spread.title: energy_spread

flux.description: the flux of incoming particles in particle/s
flux.title: flux

material_density.description: the material density in g/cm3 by default he Si value at roomtemperature is parsed i.e. 2.3290 g/cm3
material_density.title: material_density

particle_direction.description: "isotropic" : particles are coming from all directions (outside of thesensor) "orthogonal" : particles are coming from the top of the sensor(thickness = 0) and orthogonal to its surface
particle_direction.title: particle_direction

step_size.description: the size of the considered unitary step in unit length along whichenergy is deposited
step_size.title: step_size

stopping_power_curve.description: the location of the file describing the total massive stopping powerenergetic loss per mass of material and per unit path length versusparticle energy note that the the stopping power curve is assumed tobe a csv file with two columns [energy, stopping power] energy in MeV,stopping power in MeV cm2/g
stopping_power_curve.title: stopping_power_curve

ModelChargeGenerationChargeDeposition.title: Model 'charge_deposition'

ModelChargeGenerationChargeDepositionInM.description: Simulate charge deposition by ionizing particles using a stoppingpower curve.

cutoff_wavelength.description: the longest wavelength in micrometer at which the QE reaches 50% ofits maximum, used to compute the bandgap energy, and the correspondingfraction of cadmium
cutoff_wavelength.title: cutoff_wavelength

energy_mean.description: the mean energy of the incoming ionizing particles in MeV
energy_mean.title: energy_mean

energy_spectrum.description: the location of the file describing the energy spectrum of incidentparticles if no spectrum is provided energies are randomly drawn froma normal distribution with mean and spread defined above note that theenergy spectrum is assumed to be a txt file with two columns [energy,flux] with the energy in MeV
energy_spectrum.title: energy_spectrum

energy_spectrum_sampling.description: "log" or None: the energy spectrum is sampled in log space "linear" :the energy spectrum is sampled in linear space
energy_spectrum_sampling.title: energy_spectrum_sampling

energy_spread.description: the spread in energy of the incoming ionizing particles in MeV
energy_spread.title: energy_spread

flux.description: the flux of incoming particles in particle/s
flux.title: flux

particle_direction.description: "isotropic" : particles are coming from all directions (outside of thesensor) "orthogonal" : particles are coming from the top of the sensor(thickness = 0) and orthogonal to its surface
particle_direction.title: particle_direction

step_size.description: the size of the considered unitary step in unit length along whichenergy is deposited
step_size.title: step_size

stopping_power_curve.description: the location of the file describing the total massive stopping powerenergetic loss per mass of material and per unit path length versusparticle energy note that the the stopping power curve is assumed tobe a csv file with two columns [energy, stopping power] energy in MeV,stopping power in MeV cm2/g
stopping_power_curve.title: stopping_power_curve

ModelChargeGenerationChargeDepositionInM.title: Model 'charge_deposition_in_mct'

initial_energy.description: Kinetic energy of particle, set `random` for random.
initial_energy.title: initial_energy

ionization_energy.description: Mean ionization energy of the semiconductor lattice.
ionization_energy.title: ionization_energy

band_gap.description: Semiconductor band_gap. If none, the one for silicon is used. Unit: eV

figure_of_merit.description: Dark current figure of merit. Unit: nA/cm^2
figure_of_merit.title: figure_of_merit

spatial_noise_factor.description: Dark current fixed pattern noise factor.
spatial_noise_factor.title: spatial_noise_factor

spatial_noise_factor.description: Dark current fixed pattern noise factor.

align.title: align

position.description: Indices of starting row and column, used when fitting charge todetector.

ModelChargeMeasurementKtcNoise.title: Model 'ktc_noise'

n_frame_overhead.description: New frame overhead in rows. This allows for a short wait at the end ofa frame before starting the next frame.
n_frame_overhead.title: n_frame_overhead

n_row_overhead.description: New row overhead in pixel. This allows for a short wait at the end ofa row before starting the next row.
n_row_overhead.title: n_row_overhead

reference_pixel_border_width.description: Width of reference pixel border around image area.
reference_pixel_border_width.title: reference_pixel_border_width

reverse_scan_direction.description: Set this True to reverse the fast scanner readout directions. Thiscapability was added to support Teledyne’s programmable fast scanreadout directions. The default setting (False) corresponds to whatHxRG detectors default to upon power up.
reverse_scan_direction.title: reverse_scan_direction

readout_noise_std.description: Readout noise standard deviation in units of electrons. Unit: electron
readout_noise_std.title: readout_noise_std

roic_drop.title: roic_drop

d_implant.description: Depth of the implamantation. Unit: um
d_implant.title: d_implant

euler_points.description: Number of points in the euler method.
euler_points.title: euler_points

phi_implant.description: Diameter of the implantation. Unit: um

gain.description: Gain to apply. By default, this is the sensitivity of charge readout.Unit: V/e-
gain.title: gain

ModelChargeTransferArcticAdd.description: Add :term:`CTI` trails to an image by trapping, releasing and movingelectrons.

express.description: As described in more detail in :cite:p:`2014:massey` section 2.1.5,the effects of each individual pixel-to-pixel transfer can be verysimilar, so multiple transfers can be computed at once for efficiency.The ``express`` input sets the number of times the transfers arecalculated.      * ``express = 1`` is the fastest and least accurate.* ``express = 2`` means the transfers are re-computed half-way throughreadout.     * ``express = N`` where ``N`` is the total number ofpixels.  Default ``express = 0`` is a convenient input for automatic``express = N``.
express.title: express

trap_densities.description: A 1D arrays of all trap species densities for serial clocking.
trap_densities.title: trap_densities

trap_release_timescales.description: A 1D arrays of all trap release timescales for serial clocking.
trap_release_timescales.title: trap_release_timescales

ModelChargeTransferArcticAdd.title: Model 'arctic_add'

ModelChargeTransferArcticRemove.description: Remove :term:`CTI` trails from an image by first modelling theaddition of :term:`CTI`.

express.description: As described in more detail in :cite:p:`2014:massey` section 2.1.5,the effects of each individual pixel-to-pixel transfer can be verysimilar, so multiple transfers can be computed at once for efficiency.The ``express`` input sets the number of times the transfers arecalculated.      * ``express = 1`` is the fastest and least accurate.* ``express = 2`` means the transfers are re-computed half-way throughreadout.     * ``express = N`` where ``N`` is the total number ofpixels.  Default ``express = 0`` is a convenient input for automatic``express = N``.
express.title: express

num_iterations.description: Number of iterations for the forward modelling. More iterationsprovide higher accuracy at the cost of longer runtime. In practice,just 1 to 3 iterations are usually sufficient.
num_iterations.title: num_iterations

ModelChargeTransferArcticRemove.title: Model 'arctic_remove'

charge_injection.description: Enable charge injection (only used in ``"parallel"`` mode).
charge_injection.title: charge_injection

direction.description: Set ``"parallel"`` for :term:`CTI` in parallel direction or``"serial"`` for :term:`CTI` in serial register.
direction.title: direction

electron_effective_mass.description: Electron effective mass in the semiconductor lattice. Unit: 1 electronmass
electron_effective_mass.title: electron_effective_mass

max_electron_volume.description: Maximum geometrical volume :math:`V_g` that electrons can occupywithin a pixel. Unit: :math:`cm^3`.
max_electron_volume.title: max_electron_volume

ModelOpticsLoadPsf.description: Load a point spread function from file and convolve the photon arraywith the PSF.

filename.description: Input filename of the point spread function.
filename.title: filename

ModelOpticsLoadPsf.title: Model 'load_psf'

ModelOpticsOpticalPsf.description: Model function for poppy optics model: convolve photon array with psf.

fov_arcsec.description: Field Of View on detector plane in arcsec.
fov_arcsec.title: fov_arcsec

optical_system.description: List of optical elements before detector with their specificarguments.
optical_system.title: optical_system

pixelscale.description: Pixel scale on detector plane (arcsec/pixel). Defines samplingresolution of :term:`PSF`.
pixelscale.title: pixelscale

wavelength.description: Wavelength of incoming light in meters.
wavelength.title: wavelength

ModelOpticsOpticalPsf.title: Model 'optical_psf'

scaling_factor.description: Scaling factor taking into account the missing pieces ofsuperconducting physics, as well as the resonator quality factor, thebias power, the quasi-particle losses, etc.
scaling_factor.title: scaling_factor

ModelPhotonGenerationIllumination.description: Generate photon uniformly over the entire array or over an elliptic orrectangular object.

object_center.description: List or tuple of length 2, two integers (row and column number),defining the coordinates of the center of the elliptic or rectangularobject.
object_center.title: object_center

object_size.description: List or tuple of length 2, integers defining the diameters of theelliptic or rectangular object in vertical and horizontal directions.
object_size.title: object_size

option.description: A string indicating the type of illumination: - ``uniform`` Uniformlyfill the entire array with photon. (Default) - ``elliptic`` Mask withelliptic object. - ``rectangular`` Mask with rectangular object.
option.title: option

time_scale.description: Time scale of the photon flux, default is 1 second. 0.001 would be ms.
time_scale.title: time_scale

ModelPhotonGenerationIllumination.title: Model 'illumination'

ModelPhotonGenerationLoadImage.description: Load :term:`FITS` file as a numpy array and add to the detector asinput image.

align.description: Keyword to align the image to detector. Can be any from: ("center","top_left", "top_right", "bottom_left", "bottom_right")
align.title: align

bit_resolution.description: Bit resolution of the loaded image.
bit_resolution.title: bit_resolution

convert_to_photons.description: If ``True``, the model converts the values of loaded image array fromADU to photon numbers for each pixel using the Photon TransferFunction: :math:`\mathit{PTF} = \mathit{quantum\_efficiency} \cdot\mathit{charge\_to\_voltage\_conversion} \cdot\mathit{pre\_amplification} \cdot \mathit{adc\_factor}`.
convert_to_photons.title: convert_to_photons

multiplier.description: Multiply photon array level with a custom number.
multiplier.title: multiplier

position.description: Indices of starting row and column, used when fitting image todetector.
position.title: position

time_scale.description: Time scale of the photon flux, default is 1 second. 0.001 would be ms.
time_scale.title: time_scale

ModelPhotonGenerationLoadImage.title: Model 'load_image'

ModelPhotonGenerationShotNoise.description: Add shot noise to the flux of photon per pixel. It can be eitherPoisson noise or Gaussian.

type.description: Choose either 'poisson' or 'normal'. Default is Poisson noise.
type.title: type

ModelPhotonGenerationShotNoise.title: Model 'shot_noise'

angle.description: Angle of the pattern in degrees.
angle.title: angle

period.description: Period of the periodic pattern in pixels.
period.title: period

startwith.description: 1 to start with high level or 0 for 0.
startwith.title: startwith

time_scale.description: Time scale of the photon flux, default is 1 second. 0.001 would be ms.
time_scale.title: time_scale

n_0.description: Material dependent single spin density of states at the Fermi-level.Unit: um^-3 eV^-1
n_0.title: n_0

t_c.description: Material dependent critical temperature. Unit: K
t_c.title: t_c

tau_0.description: Material dependent characteristic time for the electron-phononcoupling. Unit: s
tau_0.title: tau_0

ModelReadoutElectronicsSarAdc.title: Model 'sar_adc'

ModelReadoutElectronicsSarAdcWithNoise.title: Model 'sar_adc_with_noise'

ModelReadoutElectronicsSimpleAdc.description: Apply simple Analog to Digital conversion.

data_type.description: The desired data-type for the Image array. The data-type must be anunsigned integer. Valid values: 'uint16', 'uint32', 'uint64', 'uint'Invalid values: 'int16', 'int32', 'int64', 'int', 'float'...
data_type.title: data_type
